content.html:
I have my notes (powered by Shortnotes) syndicating to my account on the Indieweb.Social Mastodon instance.

I like posting on my website first‚Äîit‚Äôs fun and the flippancy feels even more so. I enjoy being able to easily reference thoughts via links so that I can hop around my site at will. It‚Äôs all so much more pleasant than Twitter.

My site supports Webmentions (powered by Webmention) so that others can engage with my website via their own. I‚Äôve decided to syndicate to Mastodon because it‚Äôs still fun to have another place to follow people who don‚Äôt yet have their websites setup to do the same.

I‚Äôll probably still load Twitter in my browser once or twice a day, but it‚Äôs just less and less appealing.

If you‚Äôd like to join Indieweb.Social, you can use this link as an invite (it will auto-follow me): https://indieweb.social/invite/8rYTJSwv

Alternatively, you can join any Mastodon instance and we can still communicate. Add me at indieweb.social/@jeremyfelt.

And of course, RSS is always there and feeds are much kinder than Twitter. üçª

Published Monday, Oct 31 at 23:01

content.html:
‚Ä¶or not.

It‚Äôs pretty great that it‚Äôs Gavin Newsom, governor of a state with one of the more advanced data privacy laws, that is somehow still able to send me email using ActionKit, an ngpvan product.

Also great: both the privacy and contact links on the unsubscribe page linked to by the email point to example.com. üôÉ

Also great: the privacy policy at ActionKit point to TRUSTe as a watchdog through which you can make a complaint. But! The ActionKit, EveryAction, and ngpvan companies do not appear in the list at TRUSTe!

Money in politics is such a sham.

Anyhow. I‚Äôve added my email to the block list again. Fingers crossed it was only Gavin.

Published Tuesday, Oct 18 at 14:32
